comment: I have never had a prof quite like her. She comes into the room on the first day and informs us she has a day job that her grades might be delayed. (That was an understatement) You HAVE to read the book. What she covers in class is nothing like thew book and the test are on the BOOK! She acted like she didn't actually like teaching  Almost forced t
Classes were extra awkward and she makes you wait forever for a grade. Tests are kinda easy, but some questions are worded weird. She was nice, and helpful when necessary.

I believe that a course of this nature (discussing privilege, racism, and other -isms) should be handled and presented with the utmost care. That being said, I feel that the professor done a lousy job of doing this. She was unorganized, pretty bad at facilitating healthy discussions & graded work at a snail's pace. She was nice, but still...

She seems like a nice person, BUT she's so unorganized & takes FOREVER to return grades. 3 textbooks required. Gives pop quizzes, midterm & final are over readings. She doesn't give a study guide, but instead gives you a very vague idea of what is on the test. Two reflection papers & requires a reflection journal for each class. Wouldn't recommend.
I had a 4.0 before I took this classs, not anymore. The professor made it harder than it needed to be.  I would not sign up for this professor again.

Not helpful, very un-organized, 5 pop quizzes, can only miss 2 classes before letter grade is dropped, group project, 2 tests (midterm and final), requires 3 books, lots of reading, power points are put online. She has only taught 1 class ever, so perhaps she was just unsure of how it works, I don't recommend her- she's nice though.
